reviews.review_msg: After reading these comments, I thought he is a good prof. But! He is from hell. In this 100 level course, not even a writing one, you are expected to write 4 essays and one group project with oral presentation. Moreover, you have to write 2 essays during 2 hours in the final. Maybe he does not know he is teaching a 100 course. WTF

Stephanie has some strict rules (such as no cellphones in class and no arriving late to class), but this is a really informative class. She really knows her stuff - and supplements the lectures with youtube videos, movie clips and more. Overall it was a good class.

She comes off as unfriendly and unpleasant. At the start of the year she would flip out on students and kick them out for being even 5 minutes late for class. If you have your phone out in class she takes it away and reads your texts out to the class. She is a sessional prof that doesn't seem very interested in helping to educate today's youth.

Pretty easy class as long as you attend the lectures. Map quiz is definitely do-able with lots of studying. Writing assignment wasn't bad. She will answer any question you ask her, but I found her a bit disrespectful at times to students, especially the late ones.
She's okay. She marks paper hard, but her midterm and final are easy. She doesn't like the people who are late for the class, so you should be on time. Overall, she's a fine prof.

She is way to anal about cell phones and late people. Once someone came in 5 minutes late and she made them leave....we had 2 hours left of class! She says 'right' and 'yeah' way to often and isn't very clear with her marking scheme on assignments.

A good instructor, though she marks very hard. Expect to achieve 10-20% less than what you are used to. She is a no-nonsense professor who is very in control of her class. Despite her approach, she forces you to work harder and be a better student.  I would take another course with her.
I really don't like her. She is not a bad lecturer but her assignments and map tests ugh. She takes the class too seriously! Lighten Up

Not only is she a bad teacher she is super mean and annoying!!! She kicks people out for being late to class and she can never ask anything nicely (she always yells your going to have to do...) The combination of her saying "does that make sense" every 2 minutes and just the sound of her voice make the lectures unbearable!

There's a way to do well in her class. I got an A- off just studying for 6 hrs rite b4 the mdterm and final. First, take notes vigorously! I mean get down all she says. Have a laptop?, all the better, cuz that is the only way to ace her class. When reading over the notes, the only way to remember them is rewrite them, then just reread and u'll ace.
I think you are complaining too much.  The exam questions came right from her lectures.  She answers any question you ask her.

The course would benefit from more interesting graphics and photographs in the lectures. Since this is an introductory course, there is a lot of memorization and a lot of material to plow through. Although encouraged to "think about" the concepts, when it came to assignments, the TA's were not able to recognize thinking outside the box.
Good professor

Sue is the best prof I've had during the pandemic. She gave us the most freedom in how you choose to study, and was quick to respond to my email when I had a tech issue. Exams were both fair. The hardest marking was on discussion exercises, which were still very fair. Read the textbook, do the weekly quizzes and you'll do well.

Owens did well teaching the class. In my opinion, there was a TON of content to work through every week. She had lecture videos(2.5hrs/week), textbook readings (30+pages/week), and quizzes. The course content is quite bland but is not hard to understand. She seemed like she actually cared about her students and tried to help us if we needed it.

Really cares for students and wants them to succeed. Structured the course really well and assignments/quizzes were very enjoyable. Study guide was given for both mid term and final which really helps in studying. Would highly recommend taking a course with Susan if you can!
Don't take him. Save your GPA.

He is very knowledgeable in the subject he teaches. Attending class is not mandatory because lectures are voice recorded but try to watch the video he shows in class because it might come up in the test. Assignment wise, I would say it's pretty straight forward. My only complaint is that different TAs have different marking style for the papers.
I don't want this to become an angry rant, so I will just warn everyone, taking his class will be a very serious waste of GPA
i found that if you do your readings and attend lectures its not hard at all to get a decent mark. on the plus side hes funny and not bad to look at at all

I just want to warn anyone who wants to take a class with him. Don't. Essay questions are completely unrelated to the answers he wants you to somehow magically produce, and topics covered in depth in class are not included on exams. I would highly recommend that unless you want to get 4/15 on a 100 level essay, you wait for another prof.

class topics are interesting. he gives quite a bit of examples. but the exams are relly tough- all written. he wants exact definations. and long answer questions are really hard. no one gets full marks. same with essays. marks hard. but hes cute
The class was fun but lacked any real substance. Prof is a graduate student with limited knowledge. I fear I won't be prepared well for other courses.
Fun Teacher, Fun Class!
Probably the best prof I've had so far.  Clear, helpful, passionate, easy on the eyes, funny, knowledgeable.  Take a class with him!
Best Prof Ever! Very fair and enjoyable!

The best prof I've had so far. Made a 3 hour lecture tolerable. He obviously knows alot about the subject and is very passionate about it. He has lots of stories and I hope I'm able to take more courses with him. :)

Lectures were very interesting. His tests were different in that we were able to choose which questions to write on. For example: choose 5 out of 8 words to write definitions for. The only negative feedback was he was very slow in marking and putting up lecture notes, assignments, grades. Other than that, great class!

He is a great teacher and thoroughly explains the material covered in his lectures. However just memorizing his lecture slides is not enough; make sure to memorize the textbook even though it is not used at all in the lecture. If you do this you will do very well in his class.

Very nice professor. Tends to go quite fast in lectures, but posts all his notes on webct. Not too much work required from this course other than a term paper and a few short assignments. His midterm and final are very easy if you can memorize and write well. He's a great guy, highly recommended!

marks very hard and teaches really fast like he needs to go to the bathroom. The powerpoint notes overwhelms each class. Don't expect a high mark in this course if u take it at all. Not an easy course but a useless one.

In the beginning, when the notes were not online, it was almost impossible to take notes because of the speed he goes through the slides at, but it got better when he started posting the notes online. I wish he posted the notes more frequently, however, because it usually takes at least 2 wks for him to post units which have already been covered...

The textbook is quite expensive but pretty essential to passing! Take the map quiz seriously, it'll definitely help your grade. The lectures were quite interesting. This professor is very enthusiastic about the material, which is awesome! I would definitely recommend this class, but be prepared to work for your grade.

Ivor is very passionate about geography. He however, is an old school professor and does not use powerpoints or display lecture notes. You need to keep on top of lecture as the material is key to passing. Extremely difficult tests that he is proud of and term paper criteria is vague at best.

Winton is old school which means you have to work hard for your marks. No freebies. He did say in his lecture that no one will receive an A, which I found a little daunting, however, he is a very good lecturer and keeps the class engaged. You will learn from him but if your looking for an easy class, this is not it. Memorize your 600 page textbook!

I don't know what these people are talking about. If you read the textbook and pay attention in lecture, there's nothing he puts on the test that's unexpected. He's super enthusiastic, and an exciting lecturer. Don't expect this course to be an easy A+, but A+ is definitely attainable.

Don't let the comments for this class scare you off. It's most certainly not an "easy A," and his exams with destroy you if you don't study. However, Winton is very clear and interesting to listen to in Lecture. He finds email inefficient, but he is very helpful and kind if you attend his office hours and get to know him. Great prof. Great class.

I've never had a prof that refuses to talk to students after class or during breaks, but then there's Ivor. He just absolutely refuses to accept emails, and honestly he's quite rude. An interesting, passionate, and funny lecturer, but his tests are unfair, and he never has slides. Bring laptop to take notes, and you BETTER read the textbook.
He only give his outline, never have lecture notes, class average is very low, and he never reply emails.

hes a good teacher and he knows what hes teaching. the problem i had is if youre an engineering student or similar and are taking a set of other heavyloaded courses, this course is NOT gonna help which in that case wont be a GPA booster.

Ih, what can I say. The class I guess you can call it straight forward. He always reads his notes in a very quirky way. He does like to play with his vocal strings. map quiz is pretty easy if you are good with memorization. The term paper is pretty iffy, but nothing bad. His midterm/final tho is most likely going to destroy you. Not an easy B even

Actually a great class, the lectures are very intriguing. Ivor is a funny guy in a quirky way. You need to attend the lectures, he does not use a powerpoint and the outlines he sends out are very limited. Do the readings, they're necessary. And most of all prepare for the map quiz, it is most definitely worth it

Ivor is an old school professor. Don't expect to come to this class for an easy grade. Pay attention in lectures and you will do fine. He makes it pretty obvious what to revise for during his lectures. I don't know why people complain so much about the map quiz. You have FOUR attempts to get over 15. Very doable if you put the time in.

All you have to do to do well in this class is: Attend ALL lectures; read what he assigns; DO NOT write notes on the textbook, that's a waste of time. Just write out all bolded definitions and memorize the definition and spelling; do well on the map quiz(print mutiple copies of each conitent and label all the places he tells you to and memorize).
Toooooo hard!!!! Gpa killer
Ivor is a great prof! really know is stuff.  exams were a bit tough but not the end of the world. read the text book and study the notes!  get through the map quiz and the essay and you'll be fine!

Prof made topic interesting. But theres no power points at all! You have to listen to him to take notes. Often times, you miss out on keypoints. His midterm and final was unfair and very hard. Even the Essay was marked very hard!
Harsh marker. Midterm was wack, but final was very fair. Must read and think about text to do well. Extremely helpful, even emails summaries of his lectures. Lectures seem to model good essay style.

Sadly, lectures are just for fun, except formulas and definitions.  Tests on trivial and obscure details, most from the text and never discussed in class. Stickler for style details. Map quiz = gift points, if you study and learn your world locations. He's helpful, approachable, despite bragging how tough a marker he is.  Just the exam was BS.

Ivor is awesome! One of the most engaging and entertaining lecturers at SFU. It's definitely not an easy class, but Ivor is so passionate and so good at presenting information it's so worth your time! Map quiz will boost your grade if you are good at memorization, will sink it if not. Midterm/Final asks a few questions about minute details.

Extremely hard marker. Does not give you chance in midterm markings. His Final Exam was extremely difficult. a little unfair final exam. I find the mapquiz is fair because students get 4 attempts to get 20%. the mandatory essay is fair. MT and Final are Difficult.
Not fair. bad pro. hate map qiuz

Map quiz, worth 20% is not fair at all. 15/20 = pass, anything else, will ruin your GPA this is a Gpa deflator course! I feel like dropping his course because of the unfair marking systems!! IVOR isn't concerned whether you pass or not! He says you gotta pass that 15/20 Map Quiz! It's unfair because most of us dont know WORLD GEO in an INTRO class!
Too difficult of the map qiuz, he only give u half mark of map qiuz if your mark is below 15.. it's too hard!!
I have nth to say instead his mt is hard and mean is usually fail range! u decide whether u want to choose him

Like another commenter said before, going to his class is a pleasure. He makes geography interesting. He may be a hard marker but his lectures relate to current events and enjoyable. He also gives you a  4 chances in the geography quiz which is quite lenient.

took Human Geography with him and he really has a passion for this stuff. Lectures are not mandatory as all the information you need are in the book but his lectures are interesting and is a better way to absorb material than reading the long, long book. Very approachable.
He is the worst maker ever in sfu. Don't take his course. Dont expect any As or Bs.

This Guy's Map Quiz always boosts everyones marks up. I aced the map quiz, got a B on the paper, and barely passed both the midterm and the Final and I still got a final mark of a B. A perfect GPA booster. Has a really thick accent however.
thanks for making it interesting!! I love maps!!

I personally dont like this class.  Not because of the class material, but because the teacher's marking is totally unfair.  This is almost an "open secret" for many students who is taking/took his course. By the way the class average is often lower then other geog classes.

Ivor is a brutal teacher. He is a very hard marker and I would not recommend him as a prof to anyone. His marking requires specific answers, even when you answer the question correct he still only wants to see what he wants and will take marks off for it.

He is pretty hard without proper lecture notes, unless you want to major on Geography.  Otherwise, don't take it.  You must have very good marks on map quiz and the research project.  If not, you must fail on his midterm and final.
to be honestly, i have "no comment" with this teacher..never recommend anyone to take his class unless you want to lower your GPA..

the class wasnt that tough..at least he (the teacher)gives you few chances on a quiz and so..but his teaching style is very distint from others..which made manys students confuse..and therefore grade was deeply affected...In my personal opinion..only to be avoid..
very interesting lectures! exams are not that hard if lectures are attended
Five star prof. One of my favorites so far. Vast knowledge, quite exciting lectures, and overall personality account to a memorable learning experience. Highly recommended!
the worst class i have taken in SFU
Midterms and finals are extremely hard. Tough and unfair marker. Lectures run over time. Expects you to know every single detail, which is impossible, instead of focusing on the general information.
great prof but H-A-R-D exams

all i have to say is he is absolutely a HORRIBLE prof. he's loud and basically repeats things over and over and over until you want to kill yourself. Always keeps you after class making you late for other more important things.
midterms and finals are EXTREMELY hard. but you get to make up your mark in quizzes and essay. read the book and make sure u know it well

The speed of his classes are hard to keep up, and the things he says aren't in your text, but on test. Also, he shows no mercy when it comes to marking. Be prepared to remember more than just the definitions in bold, remember it word for word, because there are no multiple-choice Qs on the exams.
oh my gog! if you don't have to take this class DON'T. He's very interesting, but if you don't have the textbook memorized...prepare to get a bad grade.

midterms and final are very difficult!!! map test was really easy, just make sure u know everything on the maps, plus he gives u 3 times to get perfect! on his tests he takes off fractions of a point if you didnt write a word in for your definitions...interesting lecturer, but marks are low!!!

His lectures are brutally boring and his tests are next to impossible.  Make sure, if you take this class, that you study hard for the map quizzes because they really make a big difference in your mark.  Overall, however, Ivor is a Geography fanatic who doesn't seem to understand why everyone is NOT
very right wing pro-capitalism guy... :(  manipulates history and keeps bashing communism without actually knowing what he is talking about... :(
What an amazing speaker! He gave great notes and made the lectures interesting to listen to. I found him to be a great Prof!
who can understand what he "talking"about??? his speach is very unclear~>"<

Easily one of the most passionate and enthusiastic professors ever. Very knowledgeable and gets you interested. Remember, if you like Geography, he likes you. If you don't like geography, he will still remember your name.
too hard
good lecturer, and knowledgble, but the final is tough, guys. the good news is the mid-term is pretty fair. and the mark on the paper is harsh.

Good Lectures BUT completly irrelevent to tests. class average on exams were 47%. if you know everything from the lectures and text and i mean everything (even captions from pictures) you will do pretty good. Map quiz is easy, staright memo of 150 things
Awsome lecturer!  Free marks (map quizes), easy exams, easy marker.  Great course for new 1st year students.

This class wasn't too bad. He's a pretty nice guy and I didn't find the midterms too difficult. Be prepared to write a lot in these lectures (he doesn't use power point or anything...you have to take notes right from what he says) and do well onthemapquiz
this guy sucks
Great lecturer. Tries hard to mae sure material is interesting, and incorporates good examples. Tests are kinda hard, though.

Interesting subject, the lectures were sometimes boring but usually good. His exams were killer - he tests on insignificant details and not the main ideas. Really stupid assignments. Accent can be hard to understand.
Exams are way too hard and only test you on the insignificant details of the course.
...nice guy....but can produce some hard tests!
Well informed and knowledgable about the subject matter.  Has absolutely no compassion for his students, will yell at students in front of an entire lecture hall just for eating a granola bar.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS.  He is boring, he teaches in an ol' English Crotch-up-the-ass conservative way.  3 hours of PURE hell.  just rote memorizing.  Also, the textbook he uses is extremely rightwing. all in all: eurocentric, boring, annoying

Notice the size of the questions marks beside each incorrect answer on exam: small question mark means you got part of it but not his answer, medium size means you're veering off the track, and large size means you're way off and it's garbage
Any teacher who tries to make a fairly cut and dry subject like this interesting and well communicated gets a 5 on my rating for clarity.

Not anywhere near as hard as made out to be. Great lectures for those who care about such trivial matters as actually learning and thinking instead of the usual tripe that spews forth in great quantities in the arts departments of modern universities.
No Comments

Great teacher for a slightly tougher course, after experiencing many courses at sfu, he is one of the best profs I've had: Communicates material clearly and keeps his students interested in the subject matter.
I agree with what everyone else says, hard tests! Map quiz helps
CONCISE LECTURER, HARD EXAMS...
VERY TOUGH & TRICKY exam!!!!!pay EXTRA attention to the textbook & the extra material that he gave in the lecture
VERY MEAN MARKER AND COMPLETELY UNHELPFUL - TOO bad his lectures are so interesting
No Comments
Great accent, very entertaining lecturer, overall nice guy - brutal marker however, so be sure to ace the map quizzes.
Vicious marker, mean-spirited and unhelpful comments, but decent lectures...
Very hard marker-know the def of  ecumene
Hard Marker, but funny as hell. Take very good notes
best lecturer i've ever had
Very unhelpful and very, very mean...
hard marker, hard and tricky final
Good lecturer but beware of tricky exams (tries to confuse students!)
Good teacher but hard marker and grades will suffer.
Has fierce accent and loud voice; okay marker; map quiz is easy
Midterm and finals very hard, beware. Be very good lecturer.
study every little term if you want to do well on the exams!!!
I learned alot from his lectures but my marks didn't show it.
Made every lecture and enjoyed them.
Good lecturer (makes class interesting), but a VERY hard marker!
Excellent lecturer, exams are fair, map quiz is easy marks, tough marker
STAY AWAY!!!!
Take this course only if you want to LEARN... be warned, your grades will suffer
The essay component pisses me off...
Pretty Good...Clear but a bit LOUD at times...wakes ya up in the mornin'.
No Comments
excellent lecturer, very tough marker
Amazing lecturer: enthusiastic, clear, and funny.  Tough exams though.
No Comments
Great lecturer, makes material interesting. Map quiz can make/break your grade.
Riveting lecturer.  If you are in school to LEARN (not GPA), take this course!
Dramatic, clear speaker.  Outlines concepts well,  provides critical perspective
Not bad, enjoys the subject, but hate the map quizzes
No Comments
Most Difficult Prof Of All Time
No Comments
worst mark i've had in all 4 years,
No Comments
No Comments
Give Up
GPA KILLER
Never detested a course so much in my life
So much fun!  Funny and interesting.  Likes what he teaches!
Teaches the intro course like it's 3rd/4th year! Way to turn people off of Geog!
He's a muddling technophobic old codger.

GPA BOOSTER IS A JOKE! GEOG 100 WITH THIS GUY IS A GPA DROPPER! Weekly quizzes are like weekly midterms, lectures are long and boring and not helpful, he never replies emails, gives everyone anxiety with his rules for a closed book exam, and most importantly the exams are unnecessarily long and hard! BE GOOD TO YOURSELF! DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS!

The exam content is very much, three hours to write a lot of text, and the exam is closed book, not a single notes. Such a difficult exam, the teacher is very strict to catch cheating, students copy and paste translation software are not good. And he likes surprise inspection, deliberately embarrass a lot of students.

don't take his course for gpa booster!! he put too many question in mid and final, which take 55% of this course. he also has many rubrics for exam. if you write something with high similarity with text book or ppt, he will think you are cheating and give you a zero without any explain by yourself. I will never take his course again.

The most horrible prof I've ever seen during my time in university. This prof teaches a 100 level course like a 200-300 level course. Quizzes and exams are lengthy and hard to relate to course material. Not a great idea to take this course if you wanna meet your wqb requirements or you wanna get an elective. This prof is unresponsive as well.

One of the worst experiences I've ever had in my whole education career. Do NOT take if you want an easy elective or GPA booster. Way too strict for a 100-level course. Tests are HEAVY with lots of short answer q's, final also has a short essay question and does not give enough time to complete.
The worst prof I have ever seen. Large exam questions on midterm and final exam. Teach nothing and read the ppt All the time in the record video. And the exam question hardly related to the ppt.

His final had way too much many questions to finish and he did not provide enough time. His quizzes are hard and lengthy. His course seems like an advanced course, not an introductory course. He did not reply to his emails. He is ruining people's GPAs!DO NOT EVER TAKE HIS COURSE!
He is one of the worst profs ever, save yourself money and time and don't take his courses! Your GPA will thank you.
He may be a very nice professor, but I dont know how his quiz content is related to the content of the class. You may need to read books.

Get ready to teach yo self if you have him. TONS of quizzes and they are LONG and HARD. Assignment topics not even found in textbook. All recorded lectures and slides are barely helpful or relevant to the quizzes. He is not responsive, likes frustrating students and blaming on them. -10/10, a very disappointing experience as taking a 100 course.

Young is one of my favourite profs I'm actually surprised by some of the negative posts on here! He's incredibly passionate + able to keep lecs fun (sometimes awkward/cringey) but it keeps you entertained enough to keep listening to the arguably dry human geog content. Pay attention to examples explained in lecture as they can show up on the exams.

Talks about coffee way too much but besides that he's nice and class is super easy. Just hope he doesn't use Pearson textbook because its a waste of money and textbook is unnecessary. There was one paper that was easy to write and tests can be quite long

we have online course now. the midterm has lot of questions that nobody can finish it in limited time. we do not have live course and professor's recordings. we only have textbook and ppt. but not all chapters have ppt. Is this how we're supposed to teach ourselves? i can not understand.

I took GEOG 100 with him in the fall 19. One thing that really bugged me was that his powerpoints were structured in a very disorganized way. He didnt need to be funny, tbh. We came to learn. Theres a lot to cover each class, getting the slides more organized will help the students who attend lecture to follow better.

Good Prof. Needs better criteria for his assignments. Very approachable and funny. Lectures were boring from time to time as they were up to 3 hours but Young has a sense of humor that brightens the mood. Tests are a little overkill with around 50-60 multiple choice and 60 mark written sections. Uses slides and highlights test material.

Jason was overall a nice guy, but his lectures put me to sleep especially being 3 hours long. There was some miscommunication between him and the TA for the individual assignment criteria so just beware of that. Also, I don't know why but he marked SUPER easy for the written questions so just write something down even if you don't know the answer

He would start class late or end it early. We were graded on 1 report, weekly online activities, midterm and final. Often skimmed over important topics in lecture but would ask about them on the midterm. He would emphasize what you would be on the midterm and final. He is a really weird guy and doesnt explain the topics very well, you teach urself.
the class is pretty boring at times but he is a great prof thats pretty good with engagement. He makes a lot of coffee jokes and has pretty nerdy humour which helps when classes are super long.

Just took the first midterm and got a 82%. If you are taking it for an elective then it's an awesome course to take. All you have to do is memorize the powerpoint slides and the midterm is pretty much fill in the blank from the powerpoints. No practice midterm provided. A waste of money buying the textbook, everything was off the slides.

By far the hardest class I had this semester. The lecture content was fairly disorganized, unclear and confusing. Content felt much harder than a 1st year geography class.  It's related to the text readings, but also completely different. Grading scale for tests unclear. Field project took way too much time. Doing the readings is essential.
He is very disorganized and lacks clarity. Lectures made me sleepy, tests were difficult, and the readings were long. Generally a nice guy, but I will not be taking a class with him again.

If you value your GPA, DO NOT EVER TAKE A CLASS WITH THIS GUY. For an INTRODUCTORY (100) level course, he made us read LONG SCHOLARLY level articles and expected us to be able to apply those on an IN CLASS exam essays. Not to mention the 'quizzes' (which were really tests), the long transect project,  late lecture note postings, the list goes on...

- He gave this huge group project TWO weeks before it's due and was not clear about criteria at all - Does not post his notes on Canvas - Everything is from the textbook This is supposed to be an introductory course... Yet it is the hardest course I've taken so far (I'm a 3rd year earth science major!) AVOID HIM AT ALL COSTS...

I did poorly on the first test. When I went to him to get it back, he looked at my score on the front page, whipped it in front of me to grab and said "have a good day" with a smirk on his face. I left feeling like garbage.

Grading criteria is not clear and his exams are confusing. All his written questions were hardly questions at all -just two word statements that you were supposed to guess as to how to get the five marks out of those words. He is a nice guy, but probably not fit to teach, yet. Would recommend to not take this course if he is teaching it.

I would strongly recommend not taking this course with him. For a 100 level course (and having heard previously that with other profs this course is easy), there are 4 exams (2 called quizzes but ARE DEFINITELY EXAMS), a massive project, and lots of reading. Asks a lot of questions in lectures but doesn't tell you the answers. He does not inspire.

The class average for the first of two quizzes hovered just above 50%. The class average for the midterm was only slightly higher. Mind you, this is an introductory geography course. - arrogant attitude in lectures - little to no sense of direction exists in the course. Course outline not followed. - does not help students via Canvas or email

Geoff is great at giving lectures! His testing was not hard so if you showed up to class and didn't study you could probably slide by witha B-/C+. His lectures are mandatory because he does surprise participation assignments that count for 10% of your grade. I would take his class again for sure. Not homework heavy at all, sort of read the textbook

Good prof and a very straightforward class. Tests are well-written and he's very passionate. Answers e-mails promptly. A little biased but the class is comprehensive. Textbook and attendance are necessary for 3 random participation quizzes.

Geoff was one of my favourite professors during my first semester at SFU! because of his understanding nature, his hilarious jokes, and overall engaging presence and enthusiasm for Human Geography (GEOG100). If I had studied harder and used the textbook, could have gotten an A. Class is straightforward! Show up, because you'll remember more.

Favourite prof at SFU by far! His lectures are so engaging and he does an amazing job at making the concepts clear and applicable. If you go to class, read the textbook (it's an interesting read) and understand the concepts you have a chance to get a very good grade and learn a lot from this class. 10/10 would recommend.

I am not a geography student but he made me love geography. His examples and world view will make it very easy to understand what is going on in the course. He is passionate in what he teaches which makes it interesting for the students. Very understanding and he is the first prof to schedule a field trip in a university course.

Pretty relaxed lectures and course content. Not a lot of examination. Does have a "pop-quiz" for participation that happened twice in the semester. Exams were easy. VERY interesting to listen to him speak - would recommend for any class.

I took his course because I needed a geography credit. He is an amazing lecturer and very interested in the course material. He laughs at his own jokes which makes them even more funny. He should go into politics, he's an economic geographer but I'd vote for him.
Out of the 10 or so classes I've taken hands down best prof. He's funny, the material is interesting, he try to learn your name if you sit near the front and ask occasional question. Geoff is awesome

Great professor. Very enthusiastic and interesting lectures, was never bored in his class even through the driest material. Gives you choice for the exam questions but designs them so you have to know your stuff to answer them
he is so nice and try to make class a fun.

The course would have been good if the TA Ashley wasn't so strict when marking. There were some extremely time consuming assignments for a first year class. Some of the homework instructions were unclear especially the ones that required Google Earth.

Probably my favourite professor. GEOG 100 was sometimes a little boring with content but it was designed in a way to make you relate to your place in the world and you could choose a topic you wanted to research which made the assignments interesting. She really cares about student's learning and you can see that in the way she teaches.

Absolutely loved this class. Yes, the assignments push you, but Dr. Roderick explains everything super clearly. The TA I had was fair and really helpful — definitely felt like the course was designed for students to succeed if they made an honest effort. Plus, the course materials were interesting and super relevant to real-world issues.

Incredible communication and support.
Some people complained about response times, but every time I emailed Professor Roderick, she got back to me quickly and thoroughly.  She really cares about her students succeeding — I felt like she was rooting for us the entire semester. I'd take her again!

If you want to use ChatGPT, run.  If you want to become the weaponized version of yourself, take her class.  The second you submit work that's half-baked, she politely hands you your own brain on a silver platter and asks if you'd like to try again.

Respect the craft, and for the love of academia, proofread your thesis statements.

The professor was good, but the homework criteria are very vague and I had trouble understanding it every time and had to ask and get answers very late. Ashley, the teaching assistant, was so rude, crazy and unfair that you have no idea. This course is not for improving your GPA at all and is as heavy as a level 4 course. Skip it if you can.

Had this prof for GEOG104 and it was great. But wow, a complete 180 for GEOG100. Like everyone else has said, assignment criteria/instructions were all over the place and really harsh/unfair grading and the TAs were abysmal.

Boring recorded lectures. Vague details and instructions for assignments. Emailed the teacher for help multiple times, and her only response was "refer to the discussions" which helped somewhat, but if you're going to respond to me, you might as well answer my questions. Ashley Tegart, the TA, was such a hard marker. She is (NOT) paycheck stealing.

Lackluster lecture videos. Assignment instructions were always confusing, vague, and filled with errors. To make matters worse, the TAs (specifically Ashley) were extremely unfair, harsh, and inaccurate with marking. Genuinely have never seen such strict and unfair marking policies.

Easy weekly activities worth 5 percent,  but the assignment grading seemed erratic and unclear. The projects were also very time consuming and the prof was not reachable at all outside class discussions form. You need to book office hours weeks in advance and prof would often just not show up.

Does not seem like Prof cared about this course. She uses 10 min pre recorded vids per week. All the learning is self directed from the textbook, prof offer no explanation or direction. The assignment instructions are vague, TA's use arbitrary and biased marking schemes, overall lack of effort from the teaching team.

She's a very nice and flexible prof. I think the people who gave her a low score expected the class to be a super easy gpa booster without putting much work in. That being said, it's almost impossible to get an A+ because the TA are very particular and hash, but an A or A- is very achievable if you do all the work and put in some effort.
The proff is good however, the T.A's in this course are awful. They are nit picky and mark you very heavily on assignments. Warning: Only take this course if you're ready to impress the TAs.

Assignments with 3 day grace period. Only Drawback is that she does not reply to your email and even in discussion forum quicky, even though she says she checks it all the time. Many students have complained regarding the Google Earth not working properly but she does not help in fixing the issue and we as students are missing marks on it.

I've taken 2 online GEOG classes with Leanne and she's great! She is flexible with deadlines and has detailed assignment instructions. Her content usually includes a lot of material but there were no exams. She allows you to skip a couple of quizzes and discussion posts with no deductions.
snooze fest + D tier TA's

great prof, super caring and was super flexible for almost all deadlines. The class material is boring and easy to the point where the quizzes are straight logic. TAs are awful tho especially jade, they mark extremely hard despite the lack of instructions on the rubric and are extremely condescending when giving feedback. Kaku was the only good TA

Dr. Roderick is a great prof - most if not all of the TAs were awful. Each CEA was graded so harshly, don't even know how anyone can get more than 4-4.5 / 5 on those. Lots of due dates each week. Overall, Dr. Roderick tried teaching as best as possible, but the TAs made the course a really bad experience. If your grade drops early on, good luck..

There is nothing to say about the professor, she is genuinely caring about the students. However, the TAs are the absolute disaster. No explanation on the rubrics, no guidance, feels like the purposefully try to grade you average. Seemed like the expectations from the professors and marking team differ. Unprofessional attitude of TA was horrible

Dr. Roderick was super approachable in the discussion forums. Intersession is very intense but I feel she paced the course in the best way possible given the time crunch. EXTREMELY forgiving late policy as well! Only complaint is each TA had a wildly different harshness for marking. She genuinely wants you to enjoy geography, overall great prof!

This class isn't hard like the others are saying, but it's extremely boring and there's a lot of busy work. The content is uninteresting and the rubric is really vague. The TAs pretty much slap a Meets Expectation on everything and call it a day to meet a certain average. Overall I would not take this class again, absolute snooze fest.

idk why people are saying "there's so many assignments" as if this course is not condensed into a half semester course... Shes a good and nice prof overall and she gives a three day grace period so you can hand in your stuff later. Im balancing a part time job, social life and school and its manageable. Take her in the fall if you struggle

The prof herself is OK but the course is  intense. If you take it intersession, there's a heavy amount of work you have to do every week. If you're keeping up with the course, there's always something almost due every single day. Moreover, the TAs mark hard, where this course is not even being a GPA booster. Only take this course if you love geog

I am so upset over the overwhelming amount of assignment this professor is giving us. There is no break, doing assigments even on weekends! If you are looking for something easy for summer this is NOT THE COURSE. I am so overwhelmed. I will never take this professor again!!!!

Way too many pointless tasks and assignments that take too long. I'm paying too much money for this course to reflect on my time in nature and to write a letter to my future self Lol. This is stuff I did in grade 4.

If you are looking for something light, do not take this class. It's a 100 level course, yet it feels like a 300 level course with the amount of work you have to put in. I don't know what's wrong with that professor.

It's a good course to take. I took the readings instead of the lecture, as it helped much more. She uses a completed/uncompleted grading system, so it's almost a guaranteed B or B+. However, if you wanted an A or higher you would have to do extra projects, which I did, but I didn't meet the criteria on one thing which messed me up.

Dr. Roderick is a solid professor, but this course is way too much work. For a three-credit course, the workload is too heavy. Some weeks you submit over 3000 words in assignments. If you do the work, you can get a guaranteed "A," but you must invest a lot of time in the course, which can be difficult if you are balancing a full course load.

Super supportive no matter the situation. My biggest advice is just get the work done like no matter how tedious it seems. It's very work-heavy, lot's of assignments and projects that take a while to complete, but none of it is hard at all. She also let's you make changes to literally every assignment, so if u keep up it's a guaranteed A.
Very simple class. Though pay close attention to the extra assignments to increase your mark as 1 assignment could prevent you from reaching anything higher than a B+

Dr. Roderick is caring, kind, and very responsive in emails/office hours. Although it isn't really in her control, this course requires a lot of effort as it is mostly labour-based grading. I was caught off guard at the amount of work required to do well in the course seeing as it is a first year course, but if you work hard, it is feasible.
Great professor. Caring and flexible. intriguing lectures that relate to real world problems to make it more more engaging.
Nick is an amazing professor. He is very engaging and passionate about human geography. I genuinely found this class interesting as it touched on many global topics. This class was a GPA booster.
Nick is a very passionate guy. Should read lecture summaries and look at quizzes for midterm/final

Amazing prof that cares! Little homework and some pop-up mini papers in class, but they can be in point form and the questions are straightforward and easy. The exams are also really straightforward and easy and it is half multiple choice and half writing. The writing part is to write abt 2 definitions and 1 topic, and they are easy to write about.

Nick was an amazing professor and the semester was great until the final. After starting fairly late, there were multiple grammar errors and other random errors in the final which made the multiple-choice questions confusing. Considering the final was worth 40% it would have been nice for it to have been read over beforehand

He was my fav prof for the semester. He provides lecture slides, notes, and recordings so technically attendance isn't mandatory but their are pop quizzes in some classes. But this class is interesting and he has a good personality which makes you want to go to class anyways. haven't done the final yet but midterm was good.
I really enjoyed his lecturing style. He really knew what he was talking about. I learned a lot in his class and he seemed like a nice guy too.

This guy is super friendly and his lectures are engaging. Participation doesn't matter, but every few classes an in-class mini-paper is assigned that counts for marks. Mastering Geography online homework is also simple and easy to understand. Would definitely take this class again if I could!

Blomley is straightforward with exams and is an amazing lecturer. He covers really interesting topics and is super approachable. Mastering Geography textbook homework is very simple each week. There were video quizzes as well which were easy to complete. His exams are mostly based off his lectures, he provided recordings and posted his slides!

NOT A HUGE FAN OF GEOG BUT THIS HAS TO BE ONE OF MY FAV PROFS! Super sweet, easy grader, easy miterm/final exams. The textbook was useless cause he straight up said he would only be testing off his lecture notes for both the midterm/final. Engaging lectures and genuinely cares about his students. 10/10 would recommend :)

he is a decent teacher, his accent plays a big role. just has a LOT of reading and self teaching straight from the textbook which SUCKS but I don't think that making the class hard is his intention... but yeah, study study study and read read read and study read read study and you should be able to just pass :) good luck!!

Nick is a good prof, and I enjoyed the course. He does a really good job of explaining concepts and keeping course material interesting. The Midterm and Final were tougher than I thought they would be, and if you want a good grade, you have to study. I wouldn't say this is a GPA booster, but if you put in the work, you should have no problems.
He is a good professor. His lecture is organized. However, his course contains many contents which require you to study hard after class. Anyone who wants to get A must study hard

Awesome Prof. Although content was dry, he tried to make the most of it by including real world examples. Tests based on lectures, so make sure you attend class or at least listen to online recordings. Great guy, and you can easily tell that he loves what he teaches.

His lectures are a little dry because the material is dry but he makes jokes to try and  make the material more interesting. Uses a lot of real world examples and exams are fair questions. Reading is heavy he wants you to read the entire chapters not just a certain pages within the chapter.

Good professor and helpful. Passionate about the environment, so much so that his Human Geo course has heavy environmental bend. He records lectures, but doesn't provide slides. Bring something to type with because he covers a lot of material. Slides are extremely helpful study notes. Midterm and exam were easy, but a lot of material to memorize.

I kinda agree with what people say about his monotone voice. But if you listen to what he says he actually has a lot of interesting things to say, though it is hard to listen when your frantically writing down what's on the slides. Most down to earth prof I have ever had, by far.

I took human geography with him. the only reason was because it was the only open class, he is okay, really tries hard to get everyone involved but that's not what always happens! doesn't like it when you don't agree with him. didnt help much with the paper, could not even clarify to me what he wanted, but the final was quite easy but go to lecture
A very nice and approachable professor, attributes which professors at SFU lack. He was extremely fair on tests and assignment.
He could be a good teacher.... if he put more life into his lecture. its to hard to focus on a quiet monotone lecture at 7 at night
3 hour lecture.... killer. he just throws a lot of info at you and its really hard to follow all of it. and his midterms and finals are rather tough. but he's a funny guy

Hes new just graded sum 09 dont bother buying the textbook I got an A didnt even read anything just memorize his lecture notes ALL of them he asks everything the notes are fill in the blanks its the essay thats horrid and the marking the eassy most people got 60/100(not cl av.) most students recieved this i never got below 80 on a paper n i got 69

This course was the easiest A+ ever. Her grading was super clear and if you miss one, that's on you as a student not the professor. A pass/fail grading scheme is based on completion marks and good faith. I'm sure the class avg would be wayyy lower if we had the traditional grading. Don't listen to the negative reviews little effort comes a long way

Dont take course with her, nothing was clear on Canvas, took me 7 weeks to figure out need 75 out of 80 to get a B level instead of 75% out of 80. Optional is not optional at all. No logic in her hw instructions , the hw req is always blur, even her TA cofused sometimes need to change grade at the end of term. just avoid

Course structure need to be changed completely, especially the labour grading, if you have so 10 rules about it why not just grade it by parts. optional grades for a level is next level bs, avoid her at all cost

worst professor I've ever had, assignment details were sketchy, unclear and confusing and she is completely unavailable for help, some assignments require downloading software that crashed my computer, I never want to see her or take a class with her again, nearly ruined my life.

I am only giving Gretchen a high rating because the course was easy! I did not attend lectures frequently, but studying at home and using the quizzes as supplementary material was very helpful. Gretchen also writes out an entire review for the midterm and final. Honestly, using this review material was enough for me to get a good grade.

Gretchen is so sweet! She really cares about her students and she just wants everyone to succeed. She gives a lot of practice questions and notes before tests. Also write down what she says during lectures, she usually gives answers and questions that are on the exams.

Go to the lectures!! She records everything but sometimes the videos don't work

Great professor - you can tell she cares a lot for her students and is really understanding. She is also accommodating and we were able to sub 30% of our midterm grade for an optional mini-essay. She audio records the lectures. I also like how fair the weight things you're being grades by is (graded by many quizzes, discussions, essays, and exams).
easy course but lectures are awkward and dull.. beware
Dr. Ferguson is very easy to approach and gives fantastic feedback. I highly recommend taking this class with her.

Amazing professor, very caring of her students. Exam + midterm short answer questions and long answer questions had options to choose from, i.e. choose 4 of 10 questions to answer for short answer and choose 1 of 6 for long answer made for very easy exams. Lectures audio recorded, lots of lowish stakes writing, online quizzes.

Lectures was fine and enjoyable. it was a hour long lecture, do have to read textbook to fill in the gaps.Graded mainly on midterm, final and a term paper. Kind and flexible professor. She dropped the last chapter from the course as final exam was scheduled 3 days after the last chapter/day of the course. You can tell she tells about her students.

This is a very easy class! I took it as a B-soc credit. The 3 hour lectures were rough, but could be interesting! Midterm and Final were extremely straightforward. The assignments are also pretty easy. Gretchen was very nice, and she knows what she's talking about! She could sometimes get carried away on tangents though.

Easy, interesting class. Gretchen's lectures were fun to listen to bc it relates to a lot of real life situations in the present world. she even shared a lot of her experiences with us. Clear lecture slides, fair assignments and exams. Not intense course load so its a very good class to take as a first year

If you don't like human geography like me, you'll find it hard to sit through her lectures. If you need to take this course, take it online or in person if it's not a 3h lecture in the afternoon. The good thing is this course is it's divided into tests and writing assignments. If you're good at at least one of them, you'll do decent. TMs are meh..

One of my favorite profs. She compares concepts to her own real-life experiences. She has traveled quite a bit so she has some real first-hand information to offer and it really helps explain by example. It's not important nor helpful to read all of the many, many assigned readings as they're long-winded and summed up in her lectures.

This class is strictly graded for a first-year course. Gretchen looks for word-for-word answers and if you don't have it the exact way you will be heavily penalized. Also, the lecture was 3hrs, very boring/dry and was hard to follow along with. Be prepared to work very hard if you want a good mark (anything above a B) from Gretchen.

Really kind prof - you could tell she cared. Material was interesting and lectures were not dry. Only thing is that she flips through slides from different lecture files quickly, so be prepared to follow along to keep up, because sometimes I found myself getting lost.
